fr.upmc.datacenter.hardware.processors.interfaces

Interface ProcessorDynamicStateI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI.DataI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI.DataI, java.io.Serializable, TimeStampingI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProcessorDynamicState

    public interface ProcessorDynamicStateI
extends fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI.DataI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI.DataI, TimeStampingI
    The interface ProcessorDynamicStateI gives access to the dynamic state information of processors transmitted by data interfaces of processors.

    Description

    The interface is used to type objects pulled from or pushed by a processor using a data interface in pull or push mode. It gives access to dynamic information, that is information subject to changes during the existence of the processor.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : April 7, 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getCoreIdleStatus(int coreNo)
      return true if the core codeNo is idle and false otherwise.
      boolean[] getCoresIdleStatus()
      return a boolean array of cores' idle status i.e., for each core i the result contains at index i true if the core i is idle and false otherwise.
      int[] getCurrentCoreFrequencies()
      return an array of the current frequencies of the cores where the frequency of core i is at position i.
      int getCurrentCoreFrequency(int coreNo)
      return the current frequency of the given core.

        getTimeStamp, getTimeStamperId
